comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Carl Hagenbeck (1844-1913) was a German wild-animal merchant who pioneered "natural" displays in zoos: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Hagenbeck

comment.author: 76016463@N00
17264356@N00
comment._content: France is a bad place to be an animal in wartime. They ate the zoo animals (at the fancy restaurants, no less) during the 1870 siege of Paris.

comment.author: 41675580@N08
comment._content:
This is the kind of history 'snippet' that is just fascinating stuff to read and see pictures of.
Thank you.

comment.author: 60188340@N04
comment._content: Any beast of burden that could be used was used. They carried or pulled ammunition, ordnance, wounded, food, medicine and the occasional General.
